Johnson Street, north side, east from Hudson to Navy Streets, showing the block of buildings that was later razed when the area became part of the site of Fort Gree Houses. View 2 shows an old stable, used for storing junk, seen in the center of view 1.

View 1: October 11, 1940
View 2: October 21, 1927

P. L. Sperr

Johnson Street, north side, east from Hudson to Navy Streets, showing the block of buildings that was later razed when the area became part of the site of Fort Gree Houses. View 2 shows an old stable, used for storing junk, seen in the center of view 1.

View 1: October 11, 1940
View 2: October 21, 1927

P. L. Sperr

1. Hudson Ave., east side, north from Johnson Street, towards the East River. July 1, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

2. Hudson Ave., n.e., from Johnson St., Bklyn. Neg. A-272
P.L. Sperr
Apr. 12, 1941

1. Hudson Ave., east side, north from Johnson Street, towards the East River. July 1, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

2. Hudson Ave., n.e., from Johnson St., Bklyn. Neg. A-272
P.L. Sperr
Apr. 12, 1941

Hudson Avenue, at Johnson Street. Shown are four views, in a southwesterly direction, across the extensive demolition area, where Fort Greene Houses will be erected. In the background is the New York Telephone Building. The four views were taken from near and around Johnson and Hudson. The Myrtle Avenue "El" appears in view 4.

P. L. Sperr

April 22, 1941
Views 1-4

Hudson Avenue, at Johnson Street. Shown are four views, in a southwesterly direction, across the extensive demolition area, where Fort Greene Houses will be erected. In the background is the New York Telephone Building. The four views were taken from near and around Johnson and Hudson. The Myrtle Avenue "El" appears in view 4.

P. L. Sperr

April 22, 1941
Views 1-4

Johnson Street, west from Hudson Avenue, showing the south side of the street in view 1 and the north side in view 2. All the buildings extending to Prince Street were razed to clear the area for the erection of Fort Greene Houses.

View 3 is northwestward from Hudson and Johnson.

P. L. Sperr

April 22, 1941
Views 1,2,3

Johnson Street, west from Hudson Avenue, showing the south side of the street in view 1 and the north side in view 2. All the buildings extending to Prince Street were razed to clear the area for the erection of Fort Greene Houses.

View 3 is northwestward from Hudson and Johnson.

P. L. Sperr
